reasons_to_visit.details: Warm temperatures (18-26°C) and long daylight hours perfect for exploring the historic center and climbing the White Tower.
Outdoor concerts in Jirásek Gardens, university cultural festivals, and open-air performances throughout the city.
Local beer gardens and outdoor terraces in full swing, offering traditional Czech beer and regional specialties.
University district comes alive with summer students, cultural events, and academic conferences.
Long summer days provide excellent lighting for capturing the city's historic architecture and gardens.

reasons_to_avoid.details: August remains busy with tourists, though less crowded than major Czech cities like Prague.
Midday temperatures can reach 26°C, making outdoor activities less comfortable during peak hours.
Some local businesses and restaurants may have reduced hours as Czechs take summer holidays.
Peak season pricing for hotels and guesthouses, though still more affordable than Prague.

activities: White Tower climb for sunset views
Evening walking tours of historic center
Outdoor café culture in Great Square

special_events.description: Outdoor classical and jazz concerts in the beautiful garden setting
Student performances, academic conferences, and cultural exhibitions
Showcase of East Bohemian cuisine and local specialties

local_tips: Visit the White Tower in the early morning or late afternoon to avoid midday heat
Enjoy beer gardens in the evening when temperatures are more comfortable
Book restaurants in advance, especially on weekends during peak season
Explore Jirásek Gardens in the morning for the best photography light
Take advantage of longer daylight hours for extended sightseeing
Visit the university district during weekdays for a more authentic local experience
